text:
What's up all my brilliant HubSpot CMS Dev folks - Have a tricky question I'm trying to figure out... not sure it's possible... but wanted to ask. 

I have a phone app side project - and in order to do deep linking into the app, I have to host a JSON file in this exact path: <https://www.keyy.io/students/assetlinks.json>

The problem is that when uploading the json file into the file manager, it includes an extra folder "/hubfs/" and places the file here: <https://www.keyy.io/hubfs/students/assetlinks.json> ... unfortunately I don't believe Google allows this extra folder path for their deep linking. 

Anyone know a way to add the file in this exact file path: <https://www.keyy.io/students/assetlinks.json> ??
Have you tried setting up a URL redirect? That might be a simple solution.
Anyone been able to successfully use the page selector field in the new beta modules? I have been able to print the page ID, but as far as I know there's no function to produce a URL from page ID.

I think I may have asked this before, is there an area/portal where we can go for stock images of HubSpot products? Say for instance we want to show the "contacts" screen but we dont want to use any client portals for it. Is there a place for this?
mine was used in a repeating module hence the `item.` selector
:raised_hands:  Thanks, really wish there was better documentation on the available variables here.
i found it through trial and error lol

Hi Mark! - I tried doing a 301 from hubfs/students/assetlinks.json to /students/assetlinks.json  ... however, that didn't appear to help. It just sent me to the original URL where the file lives anyways (hubfs/students/assetlinks.json).
I've run into a similar issue when trying to setup service workers. They have to be at the root. If anyone knows a way around this would also be interested to know.
